body_html:
Actually, this should be fixed by commit c6911fa
which makes placement of operations with eager execution similar to graph (use a GPU if available, and transparently copy).

These silent copies could be a performance bottleneck if there is too much back and forth between host and device memory. Explicitly using tf.enable_eager_execution(device_policy=tf.contrib.eager.DEVICE_PLACEMENT_EXPLICIT) will help trace those down.

body:
Actually, this should be fixed by commit c6911faaf4702096064542790d8c9e8e6f938d52
which makes placement of operations with eager execution similar to graph (use a GPU if available, and transparently copy).

These silent copies could be a performance bottleneck if there is too much back and forth between host and device memory. Explicitly using `tf.enable_eager_execution(device_policy=tf.contrib.eager.DEVICE_PLACEMENT_EXPLICIT)` will help trace those down.
